intro: Cnicus × woodwardii, commonly known as the hybrid sandthrift, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Cnicus arvensis and Cnicus benedictus, characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
